title: Yuzhong District Government and Chongqing Huaxun Real Estate Development Co., Ltd. provides anti-epidemic materials to Belarus in May 2020
description: On May 30, 2020, the Yuzhong District Government and Chongqing Huaxun Real Estate Development Co., Ltd. jointly provided anti-epidemic materials to Belarus. The donation consisted of disposable medical protective clothing and high-waist disposable medical shoe covers. These supplies were shipped to Belarus through the Belarusian Embassy in China on May 30, 2020.   The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Yuzhong District Government and Chongqing Huaxun Real Estate Development Co., Ltd. provides anti-epidemic materials to Belarus in May 2020

# Description
On May 30, 2020, the Yuzhong District Government and Chongqing Huaxun Real Estate Development Co., Ltd. jointly provided anti-epidemic materials to Belarus. The donation consisted of disposable medical protective clothing and high-waist disposable medical shoe covers. These supplies were shipped to Belarus through the Belarusian Embassy in China on May 30, 2020.   The monetary value of this donation is unknown.
justification: Project involves donation of medical supplies for public health purposes, unrelated to energy or environmental impacts
evidence: Anti-epidemic materials, medical protective clothing, medical shoe covers, health sector focus

title: Chinese government provides 10 tons of anti-epidemic equipment to Belarus in May 2020
description: On May 13, 2020, three cities in China collectively provided 10 tons of medical equipment to Belarus. The cities included Beijing, Changchun, and Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region. This donation departed from Beijing and arrived in Minsk, the capital of Belarus. This donation followed a request by the Belarusian Ministry of Health for epidemic aid. The specific contents of this donation are unknown.   The monetary value of this donation is also unknown.

title: Gansu Provincial Government sends medical supplies to Government of Belarus in April 2020
description: On April 22, 2020, the Gansu Provincial Government of China provided medical supplies to Belarus. The supplies arrived in Minsk, the capital of Belarus. The medical supplies consisted of 3,000 protective suits, 9,600 surgical masks, 2,000 pairs of medical goggles and 75,000 pairs of surgical gloves.   The monetary value of this donation is unknown.

title: China Eximbank provides 1-year maturity extension on $48.5 million preferential buyer’s credit for 330/110/10 kV Minsk-Severnaya Substation Renovation Project in 2020 (Linked to Project ID#67001)
description: On August 18, 2015, China Eximbank and the Government of Belarus signed a $48,339,072.53 preferential buyer’s credit (PBC] agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK No. PBC (2015) 11 (353)] for the 330/110/10 kV Minsk-Severnaya Substation Renovation Project. The PBC carries a 10 year maturity (estimated final maturity date: August 18, 2015). Its interest rate and grace period are unknown.  The purpose of the project was to renovate a 110 kV high-voltage overhead transmission line located in Minsk District, Minsk Oblast (phase 1) and a 330kV Minsk-Severnaya substation. This project was also designed to support another China Eximbank-financed project: a $323 million PBC for the Power Distribution System for the Belarusian Nuclear Power Plant (BNPP) Project (captured in Project ID#42422).   China Energy Engineering Group Planning & Engineering Co., Ltd. — a subsidiary of China Power Engineering Consulting Group Co Ltd. — was the contractor responsible for implementation. Phase 1 commenced in April 2017 and ended in December 2017. Phase 2 was ultimately completed on July 31, 2019. However, there is evidence that the PBC (loan) has underperformed vis-a-vis the lender’s original expectations. On or around September 16, 2019, the lender and borrower agreed to reschedule the PBC through a 5-year maturity extension (revised final maturity date: 2020). Then, on or around November 6, 2020, the lender and borrower agreed to reschedule the PBC through an additional 1-year maturity extension (revised final maturity date: 2021). Then, on or around February 21, 2022, the lender agreed to reschedule the PBC through an additional 1-year maturity extension (revised final maturity date: 2022).
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
China Eximbank provides 1-year maturity extension on $48.5 million preferential buyer’s credit for 330/110/10 kV Minsk-Severnaya Substation Renovation Project in 2020 (Linked to Project ID#67001)

# Description
On August 18, 2015, China Eximbank and the Government of Belarus signed a $48,339,072.53 preferential buyer’s credit (PBC] agreement [CHINA EXIMBANK No. PBC (2015) 11 (353)] for the 330/110/10 kV Minsk-Severnaya Substation Renovation Project. The PBC carries a 10 year maturity (estimated final maturity date: August 18, 2015). Its interest rate and grace period are unknown.  The purpose of the project was to renovate a 110 kV high-voltage overhead transmission line located in Minsk District, Minsk Oblast (phase 1) and a 330kV Minsk-Severnaya substation. This project was also designed to support another China Eximbank-financed project: a $323 million PBC for the Power Distribution System for the Belarusian Nuclear Power Plant (BNPP) Project (captured in Project ID#42422).   China Energy Engineering Group Planning & Engineering Co., Ltd. — a subsidiary of China Power Engineering Consulting Group Co Ltd. — was the contractor responsible for implementation. Phase 1 commenced in April 2017 and ended in December 2017. Phase 2 was ultimately completed on July 31, 2019. However, there is evidence that the PBC (loan) has underperformed vis-a-vis the lender’s original expectations. On or around September 16, 2019, the lender and borrower agreed to reschedule the PBC through a 5-year maturity extension (revised final maturity date: 2020). Then, on or around November 6, 2020, the lender and borrower agreed to reschedule the PBC through an additional 1-year maturity extension (revised final maturity date: 2021). Then, on or around February 21, 2022, the lender agreed to reschedule the PBC through an additional 1-year maturity extension (revised final maturity date: 2022).
justification: Project focuses on renovation of high-voltage transmission infrastructure, which supports both nuclear power and general grid operations
evidence: 330/110/10 kV substation renovation, connection to nuclear power plant distribution system

title: Chinese Embassy donates anti-epidemic materials to Benin Ministry of Foreign Affairs in May 2020
description: On May 13, 2020, the Chinese Embassy provided anti-epidemic supplies to the Benin Ministry of Foreign Affairs. The supplies included disinfectant alcohol, masks, and hand sanitizer. This donation was made to support Benin’s COVID-19 response efforts. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.  A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ambassador Peng Jingtao and the Minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation of Benin jointly attended the ceremony. The Secretary-General of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Benin, Qiao Pei, the Director of the General Office, Kang Lan, the Director-General of the Asia-Pacific University, Wen Xinon, the Political Counselor of the Embassy, Yan Yan, and other officials from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs also attended.

justification: Project focuses on health-related donation without direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation of anti-epidemic supplies (disinfectant alcohol, masks, hand sanitizer) for COVID-19 response

title: Chinese Embassy donates anti-epidemic supplies to Benin's Independent Election Commission in May 2020
description: On May 12, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Benin donated anti-epidemic supplies to Benin’s Independent Election Commission (CENA). The donated supplies included 80 hand-washing devices, 500 masks, and 200 packs of hand sanitizer. The purpose of this donation is to support Benin’s COVID-19 response efforts during the upcoming municipal elections to be held on May 17, 2020. The monetary value of this donation is unknown.   A handover ceremony was held for this donation. Ambassador Peng Jingtao and Chairman of Benin's Independent Electoral Commission (CENA) jointly attended the ceremony. The Political Counselor of the Embassy, the CENA Vice Chairman, and representative also attended.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.

title: Ningxia Health and Welfare Commission provided training to Benin's Ministry of Health to share anti-epidemic expertise
description: On March 31, 2020, the Ningxia Health and Welfare Commission hosted a remote video chat to teach anti-epidemic expertise to Benin Ministry of Health officials. The Ningxia New Coronary Pneumonia Diagnosis and Treatment Expert Group organized the call, and the Chinese Embassy in Benin as well as a Huawei representative office based in Benin reportedly oversaw technical assistance and helped to set up the logistics of the video call. The experts discussed involved standard protocol for epidemic control and prevention, as well as protection of medical workers, and patient treatment. It was stated that China will continue to keep open information with Benin to help prevent further outbreaks.

title: Shenzhen Mammoth Public Welfare Foundation, the BGI Group, the Association of Chinese Enterprises, and the Chinese Embassy jointly donate 1,500 coronavirus testing kits to Benin's Ministry of Health
description: On March 19, 2020, the Chinese Embassy in Benin held a handover ceremony to donate 1500 new coronavirus testing kits to the Benin Ministry of Health. This was done with assistance from the Shenzhen Mammoth Public Welfare Foundation, the BGI group (a private company which produces the test kits), and the Chinese Enterprise Association in Benin. The value of the donated materials is not clear.   Haruna de Kingaré, the WHO representative in Benin, and Claude Kamenga, the UNICEF Representative in Benin, were both in attendance at the handover ceremony.
staff_comments: AidData has estimated the transaction amount for this donation based on price catalogues from the World Health Organization (WHO). Please see the TUFF Methodology for additional details.
